judged_structured_information.name: CEBRA
judged_structured_information.description: A nonlinear dimensionality reduction method that leverages auxiliary (behavior) labels and/or time to discover latent features in time series data, particularly for neural embeddings. CEBRA uses contrastive learning to generate consistent embeddings across subjects, enabling both hypothesis-driven and discovery-driven analysis of neural data in relation to behavior.

papers: Learnable latent embeddings for joint behavioural and neural analysis

judged_structured_information.judge_rationale: The CEBRA resource description is well-structured and accurately aligned with appropriate ontology terms. The description clearly explains CEBRA's functionality for neural data analysis. The type (Software) and category (Dimensionality Reduction) are accurate. The general target 'Animal' is correctly mapped to the BTO ontology term. The specific targets (Rat, Macaque, Mouse) are properly mapped to their corresponding NCBITaxon terms with accurate IDs. I verified each mapping: Rattus (NCBITaxon:10114), Macaca (NCBITaxon:9541), and Mus musculus (NCBITaxon:10090) are all correct. The URL points to the official GitHub repository. The mentions section comprehensively covers related models, datasets, tools, and papers, though the papers section could benefit from including DOIs. Overall, this is a high-quality resource description with correct ontological alignments that accurately represents CEBRA in the neuroscience domain.
